qas.question: Military spending that is based on conventional threats has been dismissed as what?

What two countries were also involved in the Cold War?

What was 10% of Iraq's military budget to be invested in?

context: Dannatt criticised a remnant <b6_0>"<a0_0>Cold War mentality<a0_0/>"<b6_0/>, with military expenditures based on retaining a capability against a direct conventional strategic threat; He said currently only <a1_0><b4_0>10%<b4_0/><a1_0/> of the MoD's equipment programme budget <b7_0>between <a3_0>2003 and 2018<b7_0/><a3_0/> was to be invested in <b8_0>the "land environment"<b8_0/>—at a time when Britain was engaged in land-based wars in <a2_0><b5_0>Afghanistan and Iraq<b5_0/><a2_0/>.
